intro: Galanthus olgae-reginae, commonly known as the Olgia Reginae snowdrop, is a rare and ornamental member of the Amaryllidaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, white, bell-shaped flowers that appear in early spring. The plant typically grows in woodland or shaded areas, preferring moist, well-drained soil. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, emerging from a bulbous base. Due to its limited distribution and endangered status, it is highly valued in botanical conservation efforts.
